sentences: Ärka kontrollist ja mäleta oma kohustused.
context: The word 'kontrolli' in Estonian has multiple meanings depending on its grammatical form. As a noun, it is the genitive singular, partitive singular, or illative singular form of 'kontroll', meaning control or check. As a verb, it can be the present indicative connegative or second-person singular imperative form of 'kontrollima' (to check/control), often used as an instruction to someone to check something. In the context provided in the dictionary definition, it relates to self-control and avoiding moments of forgetfulness.
